kaladin.name: Kaladin Stormblessed
aliases: The Slave Who Saved a Kingdom

1.description: A young soldier with dark hair serving as squadleader in Brightlord Amaram's army. Known for his protective nature toward his men and medical knowledge from his father.

3.description: A former soldier now enslaved as a bridgeman after being betrayed by Amaram. Bears shash brand on forehead marking him as dangerous. Struggles with depression and suicidal thoughts.

11.description: Bridgeman who has started to care for Bridge Four despite himself. Shows medical knowledge and begins training the crew. Natural leader emerging from despair, bonded to the honorspren Syl.

65.description: Knight Radiant of the Order of Windrunners, wielding Sylblade and the power of Adhesion and Gravitation. The first Radiant to return in centuries, capable of flight and incredible feats of strength.

3.description: Young lighteyed woman from rural Jah Keved, traveling to become ward of scholar Jasnah Kholin. Artistic and witty but hides dark family secrets and financial desperation.

7.description: Jasnah's new ward studying in Kharbranth. Talented artist with exceptional memory for drawing. Pursuing scholarship while harboring hidden agenda to steal Jasnah's soulcaster.

70.description: Nascent Knight Radiant of the Order of Lightweavers, capable of Soulcasting and creating illusions. Her Shardblade is the spren Pattern, and she has begun the path of speaking Truths.

12.description: Highprince of Alethkar and brother to the late King Gavilar. Once feared as the Blackthorn for his ruthless conquests, now follows the Codes and seeks unity. Experiences strange visions during highstorms.

64.description: Chosen by the Almighty through visions to unite the highprinces and prepare for the True Desolation. His visions show him ancient Knights Radiant and guide him toward honor and leadership.

12.description: Dalinar's elder son and accomplished duelist wielding the Shardblade Mayalaran. Fashionable, popular among lighteyes, and skilled in combat, but concerned about his father's visions and their political implications.

1.description: Shin man dressed in white who possesses Surgebinding powers over Adhesion and Gravitation. Bound by mysterious oaths to obey whoever holds his oathstone, forced to kill against his beliefs.

2.description: An unusual windspren that follows Kaladin. More aware and coherent than typical spren, speaking and showing curiosity about humans. Can change size and take different forms.

11.description: Increasingly self-aware windspren who remembers things other spren forget. Shows deep concern for Kaladin's wellbeing and encourages him to care about others.

65.description: Ancient honorspren and daughter of the Stormfather. Former spren of an ancient Knight Radiant, now bonded to Kaladin as his Shardblade and companion in the Order of Windrunners.

3.description: Renowned scholar and daughter of the late King Gavilar. Known for her intelligence, atheism, and exacting standards. Researching ancient history and the Voidbringers in Kharbranth.

8.description: Soulcaster capable of transforming materials, particularly skilled at turning objects to smoke. Brilliant scholar researching the return of ancient evils, with a soulcaster fabrial disguised as a bracelet.

4.description: Large, unflappable Horneater bridgeman with a practical outlook. Serves as Bridge Four's cook and voice of reason. Has unusual eye coloring and can see spren more clearly than most.

26.description: Horneater with family in the Peaks. Reveals he comes from a family of alchemists and has some ability to see spren. Loyal to Kaladin and protective of Bridge Four.

11.description: Grizzled former soldier and the oldest member of Bridge Four. Shows military experience and becomes Kaladin's most trusted sergeant. Has knowledge of the Knights Radiant from family stories.

59.description: Former soldier whose family were secret Envisagers - people who believed in the return of the Knights Radiant. His knowledge helps Kaladin understand his growing powers.

11.description: Tall, strong bridgeman with a grudge against lighteyes. Skilled fighter who becomes one of Kaladin's most trusted men in Bridge Four. Has a dark past involving the death of his grandparents.

56.description: Bridgeman whose grandparents were killed in King Elhokar's training grounds by negligent lighteyes. His hatred of the nobility runs deep, especially toward the royal family.

14.description: Quiet, thoughtful Azish bridgeman with an education. Former student of Hoid the Worldsinger, knowledgeable about different cultures and maintains detailed notes about their experiences.
One-armed Herdazian bridgeman with an irrepressible spirit and constant jokes. Always refers to himself as 'The Lopen' and maintains optimism despite his circumstances.

11.description: Young bridgeman who initially resents Kaladin's leadership but comes to respect him. Becomes one of the more dependable members of Bridge Four.
Bridgeman from Sebarial's warcamp who transferred to Bridge Four. Quiet but reliable member of the crew with dark skin and a steady demeanor.
Bridgeman who joins Kaladin's inner circle in Bridge Four. Shows courage in battle and loyalty to the crew's new sense of purpose.
Bridgeman who becomes injured in a bridge run, losing the use of his legs. Despite his disability, remains an integral part of Bridge Four's family.
Bridgeman who initially doubts Kaladin but becomes a loyal member of Bridge Four. Shows growth from skeptic to believer in their cause.

17.description: King of Alethkar and son of the late Gavilar. Young, insecure ruler who feels inadequate compared to his father. Paranoid about assassination attempts and struggling with the burden of kingship.

55.description: Paranoid king who sees spren and patterns others cannot. His fears about assassination may be justified, and his inability to live up to his father's legacy weighs heavily on him.

17.description: Queen mother of Alethkar and widow of King Gavilar. Brilliant engineer and artifabrian fascinated with spren and fabrials. Shows growing attraction to her brother-in-law Dalinar.

61.description: Brilliant artifabrian whose research into spren and fabrials may unlock secrets of the ancient technology. Her growing relationship with Dalinar complicates court politics.

17.description: Powerful Highprince and former close friend of Dalinar and Gavilar. Ruthless pragmatist who believes in winning at any cost and sees Dalinar's honor as weakness.

73.description: Treacherous highprince who abandons Dalinar and his army to die at the Tower. His betrayal reveals the depths of his ambition and willingness to sacrifice allies for personal gain.

17.description: Dalinar's younger son, scholarly and weak of body due to blood weakness (epilepsy). Intelligent but feels inadequate compared to his warrior brother Adolin and father.

72.description: Proves his courage at the Battle of the Tower despite his physical limitations. Shows potential for leadership and tactical thinking when given the chance.

1.description: Late King of Alethkar, assassinated by Szeth at the treaty celebration. Father of Elhokar and Jasnah, brother of Dalinar. His death triggers the war on the Shattered Plains.

25.description: Visionary king who united Alethkar and had knowledge of the coming Desolation. In Dalinar's visions, appears as a great leader who understood the importance of honor and unity.

17.description: The King's Wit, a mysterious figure with the official role of insulting the king and nobles. Ancient and well-traveled, with knowledge spanning many lands and cultures.

55.description: Immortal Worldhopper with agenda spanning multiple worlds. Possesses magical abilities and vast knowledge of cosmere events. His true name is Hoid.

3.description: Bridge crew overseer with one eye, missing the other to a Parshendi arrow. Takes bribes and treats bridgemen as expendable, but has his own fears about the war and his superiors.

65.description: Reformed bridge sergeant who comes to respect Kaladin's leadership. His treatment of bridgemen improves as he sees their transformation under Kaladin.

6.description: Shallan's father, a minor lighteyes from rural Jah Keved who has fallen into debt and desperation. His family faces financial ruin and potential loss of their estate.

40.description: Abusive father whose cruelty and involvement with the Ghostbloods led to violence in their household. Shallan killed him in self-defense to protect her family.

15.description: Shallan's eldest brother who left home to seek his fortune. The family hopes he will return with resources to save their estate from creditors.
Shallan's brother who has disturbing habits of torturing small creatures. Shows signs of the family's darker tendencies under their father's influence.
One of Shallan's younger brothers, scholarly like her but worn down by their family's troubles and their father's increasing desperation.
Shallan's brother who has developed gambling problems as an escape from their family's deteriorating situation. His debts add to the family's financial woes.

6.description: Strange pattern that appears in Shallan's drawings and peripheral vision. Seems to move and change in ways that don't make sense, following her around.

70.description: Ancient cryptic spren who has been trying to bond with Shallan. Becomes her Shardblade and helps her access the Surges of Illumination and Transformation as a Lightweaver.

7.description: Young ardent who frequents the Palanaeum and shows interest in Shallan. Brings her jam and engages in philosophical discussions about religion and knowledge.

40.description: Ghostblood agent who was assigned to get close to Shallan and steal Jasnah's soulcaster. Dies from poison meant for Jasnah, showing genuine care for Shallan despite his mission.

34.description: Kaladin's father, a surgeon in the small town of Hearthstone. Pacifist who taught Kaladin medical knowledge and believes in preserving life rather than taking it.
Kaladin's mother, a kind woman who supported her family through difficult times. Taught Kaladin to read and encouraged his education beyond what was typical for darkeyes.
Kaladin's younger brother, cheerful and optimistic boy who loved collecting rocks and seeing beauty in small things. Conscripted into Amaram's army along with Kaladin.

39.description: Kaladin's beloved brother who died in his first battle despite Kaladin's efforts to protect him. His death haunts Kaladin and drives his protective instincts.

1.description: Brightlord and general commanding Kaladin's military unit. Appears to be an honorable leader concerned about his men's welfare during the battle.

39.description: Treacherous brightlord who killed Kaladin's men to steal a Shardblade Kaladin won in combat. Branded Kaladin as a slave to cover up his crime, directly causing Tien's death.

I-2.description: Parshendi leader and general who commands their armies against the Alethi. Intelligent and capable warrior who questions the endless war but feels bound by her people's decision to fight.

I-9.description: Parshendi who seeks to find stormform to give her people an advantage in the war. Struggles with the decision to seek out dangerous forms that could change her people forever.

1.description: Young, inexperienced spearman in Kaladin's squad facing his first real battle. Terrified but trying to follow orders and survive his first combat experience.

8.description: Supervising officer in charge of the bridge crews at Sadeas's warcamp. Harsh disciplinarian who treats bridgemen as disposable resources for the war effort.

9.description: Assistant to Hashal in overseeing the bridge crews. Shows particular cruelty toward the bridgemen and enjoys their suffering.

11.description: Bridgeman in Bridge Four who earned his nickname for his ability to remember and navigate terrain. Becomes one of Kaladin's trusted crew members.
Simple-minded bridgeman who doesn't speak much but follows orders faithfully. Shows hidden depths and loyalty to Bridge Four despite his limitations.
Bridgeman who dies in one of the early bridge runs under Kaladin's leadership. His death affects the crew and strengthens their resolve to survive.

14.description: Bridgeman who becomes part of Kaladin's inner circle in Bridge Four. Shows courage and growing leadership qualities under Kaladin's guidance.
Young bridgeman who looks up to Kaladin as a leader and protector. Shows enthusiasm for Bridge Four's transformation and growing sense of purpose.

13.description: Massive spren of storms who appears in Dalinar's visions. Ancient and powerful entity connected to Honor and the Knights Radiant, speaking with authority about past and future.

64.description: Cognitive shadow of Honor, the Shard of Adonalsium. Reveals himself as the source of Dalinar's visions and guide toward rebuilding the Knights Radiant.

25.description: The Almighty who appears in Dalinar's visions, revealing truths about the Knights Radiant and the coming Desolation. Shows scenes from the past to guide present actions.

64.description: Dead Shard of Adonalsium who once held the power of Honor. Killed by Odium, but his Cognitive Shadow persists as the Stormfather to guide the restoration of the Radiants.

8.description: Inkspren bonded to Jasnah Kholin, appearing as moving ink in her drawings and writings. Enables her Soulcasting abilities and serves as her Shardblade.

I-3.description: King of Kharbranth who appears to be a doddering old man but possesses Szeth's oathstone. Seeks to save his kingdom and humanity through whatever means necessary.

I-8.description: Brilliant schemer whose intelligence varies dramatically from day to day due to a magical curse. On his smartest days, created the Diagram predicting the end of the world.

53.description: Ghostblood agent who reveals himself to Shallan after Kabsal's death. Mysterious figure with connections to multiple worlds and interest in Shallan's growing abilities.

21.description: One of the ten Alethi highprinces, known for his focus on commerce and profit over military glory. Often stays out of plateau runs to focus on other ventures.
Alethi highprince who participates in the plateau runs and war against the Parshendi. Generally follows the lead of more powerful highprinces like Sadeas.
Alethi highprince involved in the war on the Shattered Plains. Participates in the plateau runs and political maneuvering among the highprince factions.

35.description: One of the Alethi highprinces participating in the war against the Parshendi. Part of the political structure that sometimes opposes Dalinar's methods.
Alethi highprince who questions Dalinar's visions and adherence to the Codes. Part of the political opposition to Dalinar's methods of warfare.
One of the ten Alethi highprinces fighting in the war. Generally follows the majority opinion among the highprinces regarding military and political decisions.
Alethi highprince participating in the Shattered Plains campaign. Part of the complex political dynamics among the ten highprinces.

28.description: Wife of Highprince Sadeas and skilled political manipulator. Works behind the scenes to advance her husband's interests and undermine his rivals.

Prelude.description: One of the ten Heralds who fought in the Desolations. After thousands of years of torture and return, he and Jezrien abandon the Oathpact, leaving Taln to bear it alone.
Leader of the Heralds and the most powerful among them. After millennia of fighting Desolations, makes the decision to abandon the Oathpact with Kalak.
Herald of War who refuses to break despite torture. The only Herald who maintains the Oathpact when the others abandon it, holding back the Desolation for 4,500 years.

Epilogue.description: The Herald who finally breaks after millennia, ending the current Desolation cycle and allowing the True Desolation to begin. Appears mad from his ordeal.

64.description: Ancient enemy mentioned in Dalinar's visions as the force that destroyed the Knights Radiant and brings the Desolations. Opposed to Honor and seeking to destroy.

Epilogue.description: Shard of Adonalsium representing divine hatred and passion. Has killed other Shards and seeks to destroy all life that doesn't serve him, now free to act with Taln's breaking.

64.description: Shard of Adonalsium that represents growth and change. Mentioned as being present on Roshar alongside Honor before Honor's death.

recaps.1: Kaladin leads his squad in battle, trying to protect young Cenn. Meanwhile, Szeth assassinates King Gavilar at a treaty celebration.
recaps.2: Eight months later, Kaladin is now a slave being transported to the Shattered Plains. A strange windspren named Syl begins following him.
recaps.3: Kaladin arrives at the warcamp and is assigned to Bridge Four. Shallan arrives in Kharbranth seeking to become Jasnah's ward.
recaps.4: Rock explains bridge crew hierarchy to Kaladin. The crew faces their first bridge run under enemy fire, experiencing the brutal reality of their role.
recaps.5: Kaladin witnesses the true cost of bridge runs as men die around him. He begins to understand the strategic purpose of the bridges in plateau assaults.
recaps.6: Shallan continues her studies with Jasnah, learning about ancient history. She struggles to find the right moment to accomplish her secret mission.
recaps.7: Shallan becomes Jasnah's ward and begins her studies. She meets the ardent Kabsal who shows interest in her.
recaps.8: Shallan attempts to steal Jasnah's soulcaster but the plan goes awry. She experiences strange phenomena during the theft attempt.
recaps.9: Kaladin survives another bridge run and begins to notice patterns in Parshendi behavior. He starts to care despite trying to remain detached.
recaps.10: Shallan's relationship with Jasnah becomes strained after the failed theft. She must find a way to explain her actions without revealing her true purpose.
recaps.11: Kaladin begins caring for wounded bridgemen and starts earning Bridge Four's respect. Syl becomes more self-aware.
recaps.12: We meet Dalinar and Adolin Kholin on the Shattered Plains. Dalinar experiences a vision during a highstorm.
recaps.13: Dalinar experiences another powerful vision during a highstorm, seeing ancient Knights Radiant. The vision's message troubles him deeply.
recaps.14: Kaladin begins to actively help wounded bridgemen, earning their gratitude. His medical knowledge from his father's training proves valuable.
recaps.15: Shallan receives word from home that increases the urgency of her mission. Her family's situation grows more desperate.
recaps.16: Kaladin's leadership begins to transform Bridge Four as he implements small changes to improve their survival chances.
recaps.17: Adolin participates in dueling competitions while Dalinar wrestles with the meaning of his visions and their implications for Alethkar.
recaps.18: Dalinar's visions intensify. His relationship with Sadeas deteriorates as political tensions rise in the warcamps.
recaps.19: Bridge Four starts working as a team under Kaladin's guidance. Their survival rate improves as they begin to trust each other.
recaps.20: Shallan's studies with Jasnah reveal more about the ancient past and the mysterious creatures called Voidbringers.
recaps.21: Dalinar faces criticism from other highprinces for his adherence to the Codes of War, which they see as weakness in their endless conflict.
recaps.22: Kaladin secures better treatment for Bridge Four through clever negotiation with Gaz. The crew begins to see him as their leader.
recaps.23: Shallan creates detailed drawings of creatures and phenomena she studies, developing her artistic skills while pursuing her research.
recaps.24: A particularly brutal bridge run tests Kaladin's resolve to protect his men. He makes difficult decisions about leadership and sacrifice.
recaps.25: Dalinar's visions show him more of the ancient past, including warnings about a coming storm that extends beyond weather.
recaps.26: Kaladin begins training Bridge Four in basic combat techniques, despite the apparent futility of their situation as bridgemen.
recaps.27: Shallan's relationship with Kabsal develops as he continues to visit her, bringing jam and philosophical discussions.
recaps.28: Sadeas and Dalinar's rivalry becomes more pronounced during joint plateau assaults, affecting military effectiveness.
recaps.29: Kaladin's efforts to improve Bridge Four's equipment and tactics begin to show results in their survival rates.
recaps.30: Shallan discovers more about the nature of spren through her studies, leading to questions about the fundamental nature of her world.
recaps.31: Dalinar considers abandoning the Codes after pressure from family and other highprinces who question his effectiveness as a military leader.
recaps.32: Bridge Four faces a dangerous situation that tests their newfound unity and Kaladin's leadership under extreme pressure.
recaps.33: Shallan's artistic abilities reveal unexpected aspects of the subjects she draws, leading to discoveries about the nature of reality.
recaps.34: Kaladin's past as Tien's brother and his father's apprentice weighs on him as he tries to save lives in an impossible situation.
recaps.35: Adolin grows concerned about his father's visions and their impact on House Kholin's political standing among the highprinces.
recaps.36: Bridge Four's camaraderie strengthens as they face increasing dangers together, developing their own identity and purpose.
recaps.37: Shallan's research into the Voidbringers yields disturbing revelations about ancient history and potential future threats.
recaps.38: Dalinar's visions become more frequent and detailed, showing him glimpses of ancient Knights Radiant and their sacred oaths.
recaps.39: Kaladin faces a moral crisis when he must choose between following orders and protecting his men during a bridge run.
recaps.40: Shallan's secret correspondence with her family reveals the growing desperation of her situation and the stakes of her mission.
recaps.41: The relationship between Kaladin and Syl deepens as she demonstrates increasingly unusual behavior for a spren.
recaps.42: Dalinar makes a significant decision about his future role based on the guidance he receives from his mysterious visions.
recaps.43: Bridge Four faces their most challenging assault yet, testing everything Kaladin has taught them about survival and teamwork.
recaps.44: Shallan's studies with Jasnah reveal connections between historical events and current threats facing the kingdoms.
recaps.45: Kaladin's medical knowledge proves crucial when Bridge Four members suffer severe injuries during a particularly bloody plateau run.
recaps.46: Dalinar's adherence to honor in warfare creates tension with Sadeas during a joint military operation on the Plains.
recaps.47: Shallan encounters unexpected dangers in Kharbranth that threaten both her mission and her safety.
recaps.48: Kaladin discovers that survival isn't enough - Bridge Four needs a greater purpose to truly escape their grim fate.
recaps.49: Adolin struggles with his father's increasing mysticism while trying to maintain House Kholin's reputation and influence.
recaps.50: Shallan's relationship with Jasnah evolves as her mentor begins to trust her with more significant research and responsibilities.
recaps.51: A major plateau assault forces Kaladin to make life-or-death decisions that will define his role as Bridge Four's leader.
recaps.52: Dalinar's visions reveal more about the ancient Radiants and their connection to the mystical forces affecting the world.
recaps.53: Shallan faces a crisis that threatens to expose her true motives to Jasnah and derail her family's desperate plan.
recaps.54: Kaladin begins to understand that his bond with Syl might be the key to transcending the limitations of his current situation.
recaps.55: Political maneuvering in the warcamps intensifies as Dalinar's rivals seek to undermine his influence and authority.
recaps.56: Bridge Four's transformation under Kaladin's leadership attracts attention from unexpected quarters in the warcamp.
recaps.57: Shallan's artistic discoveries lead to revelations about the true nature of the ancient forces that shaped her world.
recaps.58: Dalinar faces a critical test of his principles when honor conflicts with practical military necessity.
recaps.59: Kaladin's growing abilities manifest in ways that suggest his connection to Syl is far more significant than anyone realizes.
recaps.60: Shallan's mission reaches a turning point as circumstances force her to take decisive action regarding her secret objectives.
recaps.61: The rivalry between Dalinar and Sadeas comes to a head during a crucial battle that will determine the future of their alliance.
recaps.62: Bridge Four faces their ultimate test as Kaladin's leadership and their unity are challenged by seemingly impossible odds.
recaps.63: Shallan discovers the truth about her own abilities and their connection to the ancient powers she has been studying.
recaps.64: Dalinar's visions culminate in a revelation that changes his understanding of his role in the larger conflict ahead.
recaps.65: Kaladin manifests abilities that mark him as something more than an ordinary bridgeman, drawing both hope and danger.
recaps.66: Shallan's deception is revealed, forcing her to confront the consequences of her actions and make critical choices.
recaps.67: The various storylines begin to converge as the characters' destinies become intertwined with larger cosmic forces.
recaps.68: Major revelations about the nature of spren, Radiants, and the ancient conflict reshape the characters' understanding of their world.
recaps.69: Kaladin faces the culmination of his journey from slave to leader, with the fate of Bridge Four hanging in the balance.
recaps.70: Shallan's true nature is revealed as she embraces abilities she never knew she possessed, changing her relationship with Jasnah.
recaps.71: Dalinar's arc reaches its climax as he must choose between personal safety and the greater good in a moment of crisis.
recaps.72: The Battle of the Tower begins as all the main characters' storylines converge in a massive conflict on the Shattered Plains.
recaps.73: The battle intensifies as Kaladin's newfound powers are put to the ultimate test in a desperate fight for survival.
recaps.74: Revelations about the true nature of the conflict and the ancient enemies reshape everything the characters thought they knew.
recaps.75: The climactic conclusion brings together all storylines as the characters embrace their destinies and prepare for the greater war ahead.
